I legit read so much shit about the prisons all around the world and reading something like this is just so fucking awesome. Wish I could upvote this twice, I truly hope this man has a great rest of his life. Life after prison is so hard, you're pretty much isolated for a long time and to make matters worse when you get back into that society you've forgot about it's not even as easy to live in as it is for someone who hasn't been in prison.

WRITING.TITLE: Berserkers?

How did they reach this state and how would the warriors be raised/chosen etc. Pretty much just anything about Berserkers.

WRITING.TITLE: Strafing to run faster?
WRITING.TEXT: Yeah so I've been watching all sorts of speedruns from campaign to spec ops and am seeing people strafe to move quicker, but I've really found no proper guides for that. Every guide I've seen Is based on jumping longer distances but the things they do in the guides look nothing like the speedruns. If anyone could explain me how it works I'd be really thankful.

Had one when I was kid, apparently spring triggered it (very strong sunlight and a lot of wetness and snow to reflect it, along with a swimming class to fuck me up even more) started off like a normal headache to the point where I could't walk normally and threw up twice while walking to home. When I did get home I was just completely fucked, no sense of anything. All I remember is literally crying my eyes off while my mom just blocked all windows and gave me strongest medicine I could take along with something to help me sleep. Sleep made it go away, never had one since but nowadays every time I start to see weird shit and am unable to read with only one eye I just take a lot of medicine and lay in bed. Shit's fucking bad

Well long story short, Ezreal is a caster and his kit has one pretty big weakness which is short range and not strong enough autoattacks to match the hypercarries that have as short of a range. That's not really a problem since Ezreal's q deals with that issues, but if you get crit your q's wont hurt at all and your autoattacks won't be as strong no matter what you build.
So yeah, it's that simple :P
No you don't. You do not want to learn finnish :D.. 'You think you do, but you don't'
Yeah, I sort of agree. Glad I'm only in plat 4 and the games are carriable no matter how bad ezreal is

WRITING.TITLE: Important stuff for a new guy. (read faq, dont worry)
WRITING.TEXT:
----------------I DID READ FAQ--------------------------
Yeah so after finally turning 18 I decided to create a paypal. I buy a lot game related stuff online and this just felt like one of the easiest ways. So I was wanting to ask how do charge backs work? I've tried youtube searching and googling but only things that came up were some ''paypal fund creators'' which well.. yeah. Googling resulted in posts from 2013 and surely it's a bit different now?
So after making a payment is there a certain window (like 1 week or so) where you can charge back the money, and in what cases can I as seller prevent someone from charging back the payment? I read that I shouldn't sell virtual stuff, so in game items etc. but what about stuff such as clothes etc.?
Thanks for anyone who cares to take time off their day and answer, I bet you get asked this a lot, just wanted to find some relevant information.

sounds good, tbh I've never really thought about this that much. I think this one's more about what you prefer since your mid delts aren't as active as front delts during pushing, but I might give your way a try, could work for me too and increase growth, who knows!
Do people do lateral raises on push day? I've always heard people tell to do those on pull (even though it's technically pushing)

I sort of have the same problem, I don't have anyone spotting most of the time so I don't do bench with the highest possible and usually I don't do ohp at all.. But on my pull day deadlifts and bent over rows work kinda similarly for me, can't do the other one because dl's make me too tired. I just train something else between the 2 ''similar'' movements, so pull day would for example be Dl's, bicep curls, bent over rows etc.
Not sure if this works for you, I guess you could try preworkouts, even though what I kinda understood from this is that you don't run out of energy but your muscles are just too tired (I get that you could've meant this but I thought that you meant general energy at first)

I guess long arms help with something then. Lol. Never really had this problem because the bar is next to the tip of my dick at its highest point. Can't even imagine how annoying it is to finally hit that 500 only to realize you just castrated yourself
Yeah after all the point of the competition is to look ''as good as possible'' big just happens to be one good attribute there
